message_1: A store has 6 different t-shirts on display. If you want to buy 3 t-shirts, how many possible combinations of t-shirts can you buy?
message_2:
To find the number of possible combinations, we can use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of items (t-shirts), k is the number of items you want to choose (3 t-shirts), and ! denotes the factorial (the product of all positive integers up to that number).

In this case, n = 6 and k = 3.

C(6, 3) = 6! / (3!(6-3)!)

C(6, 3) = 6! / (3!3!)

C(6, 3) = (6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(3 × 2 × 1))

C(6, 3) = (720) / (6 × 6)

C(6, 3) = 720 / 36

C(6, 3) = 20

So there are 20 possible combinations of t-shirts you can buy.
